questions.question_text: An engineer must install an outdoor wireless network for an area with a direct line of sight. The outdoor APs are in an open area with a history of harsh weather. Which two parameters must the engineer consider to prevent an outdoor wireless outage? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
as the scenario is outdoor then we need protection

questions.question_text: A customer has a central Cisco WLC that manages APs in FlexConnect mode. The wireless infrastructure supports multiple small branches. One branch deploys new CCX wireless phones that are authenticated by a central Cisco ISE via PEAP/IMSCHAPv2, and traffic is switched locally. The customer must reduce the number of full authentication requests and optimize roaming for the new phones. Which action accomplishes the requirement?

choices.C: Enable Aironet IE on the voice SSID and add APs to a FlexConnect group.
choices.B: Enable Aironet IE on the voice SSID and add APs to an AP group.
choices.D: Enable CCKM on the voice SSID and add APs to an AP group.
choices.A: Enable CCKM on the voice SSID and add APs to a FlexConnect group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-1/configuration-guide/b_cg81/b_cg81_chapter_010010111.pdf
IE Aironet is used to help CCX clients choice the best AP to associate but doesn't help with roaming. CCKM with Flexconnect Groups allows for fast roaming

Selected Answer: A
A is correct, and if you think why D is not an option here, there is a reason when we have Flexconnect group the APs share cached info which is helpful for fast authentication

choices.C: The rate of retransmitted packets must be 15 percent or below.
choices.D: The rate of retransmitted packets must be 20 percent or below.
choices.B: The client device must have at least an גˆ’67 dBm RSSI.
choices.E: The client device must have at least an גˆ’65 dBm RSSI.
choices.A: The coverage area must have a noise floor that does not exceed גˆ’87 dBm.

discussion.content:
B&D should
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/technology/vowlan/troubleshooting/vowlan_troubleshoot/8_Site_Survey_RF_Design_Valid.html

RF Design Validation
1. The optimal VoWLAN Cell Edge recommendation is -67 dBm.

2. An optimal VoWLAN deployment will require at least a 20 percent cell overlap for 2.4 GHz and 15-20 percent for 5 GHz for access points that reside on different channels.

3. Over all Channel Utilization should be less than 50 percent.

4. The Noise floor should not exceed -92 dBm, which facilitates a Signal to Noise Ratio of 25 dB.

5. Retransmissions should be kept under 20 percent.

6. Packet Loss should remain under 1 percent and jitter should be kept to less than 100 ms.

Selected Answer: BD
Retransmissions should be kept under 20 percent. The optimal VoWLAN Cell Edge recommendation is -67 dBm.

Selected Answer: BD
B & D are the correct answers

comments.content:
Sorry my reply is wrong
Answer B & D

discussion.content:
I disagree
Answer should A and B
A voice design does not accept retransmission

Selected Answer: BD
RF Design Validation

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/technology/vowlan/troubleshooting/vowlan_troubleshoot/8_Site_Survey_RF_Design_Valid.html

You should measure using 5 ghz because if that works then 2.4 will for sure work. It could be either or, there isnt enough info here. If the answer says 15% i could see that. I could also see 20% it depends.

Selected Answer: BD
According to Cisco ENWLSD Course, it is B and D.

Selected Answer: BD
B AND D

questions.question_text: A wireless engineer is performing a post verification of a wireless network. Which two metrics does the engineer verify to ensure that the wireless network can support voice services? (Choose two.)

choices.D: available power sockets in the IT room
choices.C: type of site for which the survey will be performed
choices.B: number of wireless devices that require access
choices.A: security policy of the company for building access

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
The number of devices and type of environment (site survey type)

questions.question_text: An engineer must identify the network requirements for a company that has a main office and 10 branch offices. The network must be able to support data, voice, video, and location tracking. Which two factors must be considered? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I believe that having bot a and ac in same network means lower throughput. since the network should serve both, maximum data rate for 802.11a is like 54Mbps and for 802.11ac is like giga. Also having 802.11a client means more air time...

Selected Answer: A
802.11a and 802.11ac works at 5GHz and can combine channels for bigger channel widths.

Selected Answer: B
B. lower throughput

questions.question_text: During a meeting to gather the requirements for a new Wi-Fi network design, the customer requests that 802.11a and 802.11ac clients be able to connect. Which affect does this have to the wireless network?
